programme.title: Nova SS vs Honda Accord
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 Put Your Car On TV
programme.desc: On Put Your Car On TV, car fans from the Middle East can have their darlings rated in terms of speed, style and sound. Included this time: a Nova SS, a special Honda Accord and a car clad in crystals.

programme.title: Lamborghini Aventador vs GMC Chevrolet
programme.sub-title: S01 : E06 Put Your Car On TV
programme.desc: The "Walk" at JBR in Dubai is the venue for our competition, as far as fancy and luxurious cars from all over the Middle East are concerned. This time, a Lamborghini Aventador and a GMC Chevrolet are among the participants.

programme.title: Sports SUVs
programme.desc: Three extraordinarily sporty SUVs are the Porsche Macan Turbo, the Mercedes GLA 45 AMG and the Audi RSQ3. Each of these is able to easily cope with each season of the year and, in regards to performance, could be mistaken for a sports car.

programme.title: La Dolce Vita
programme.desc: With the Alfieri, Maserati in 2014 celebrated their anniversary with the introduction of a beautiful grand tourer. In remembrance and as part of the three-day celebration, Maserati organised a cruise from Bologna to Torino with some of their most iconic cars.

programme.title: Ron Williams and his Cadillac
programme.desc: The 1952 Cadillac Fleetwood is also known as the American Rolls-Royce, because it’s the car of celebrities, presidents, millionaires and mafia bosses. One owner of this rare classic car is German-American actor and entertainer Ron Williams.

programme.title: Porsche Carrera RS
programme.desc: In the early 1970s the Porsche Carrera RS was the fastest and most agile production sports car in Germany. Today the RS is a Porsche classic with highest acclaim.

programme.title: Driving pleasure in winter
programme.desc: Slippery or muddy roads and bad visibility are circumstances that often spoil driving pleasure in winter. We took two almost identical Porsche 911's to an icy test track. Also: drifting fun in the snow with the Suzuki SX4 S-Cross.

programme.title: Parking Wars
programme.desc: Not only in the big cities it's a growing struggle for parking spots. . We took the BMW X6, the Citroen Cactus and the Smart forfour to town in order to find out how these cars would cope in this situation and surrounding.

programme.title: Primm 300
programme.desc: 500 kilometres of sand and dust. The Primm 300 is the world's toughest desert rally. We accompanied the former European Rally champion Armin Schwarz to one of his toughest challenges, from the first preparations and trial runs to the finish line.

programme.title: The SUV Desert Challenge
programme.desc: Offroad legend Duncan Barbour took a group of men to Oman in order to test the off-road capabilities of the Mercedes-Benz SUV models. Also: how does the Mercedes Benz GL, a 7-seater full-size luxury SUV, perform in the urban jungle of Dubai?

programme.title: Volkswagen Beetle
programme.desc: A success story that was made in Germany: The Volkswagen Beetle. No other car has ever moved the masses so much, both in distances, as well as emotions.

programme.title: Pistenbully
programme.desc: The Pistenbully is a made in Germany powerpack traversing the ski slopes all over the world. For over 40 years it has been the undisputed number 1 among the snow groomers.

programme.title: Roding
programme.desc: What happens when four engineers fresh out of university are allowed to build a super sports car? One of the rarest and most unusual vehicles there is: the two-seater Roding Roadster.

programme.title: Walter Röhrl
programme.desc: One cannot talk about rally sports without mentioning the name Walter Röhrl. From an early age, Röhrl showed his talent in rally sports and won the European, World and other international rally championships several times in his career.

programme.title: Hans-Joachim Stuck
programme.desc: Hans-Joachim Stuck is one of the best racing drivers in Germany. Over his long career he not only won the Formula II and several international touring car championships multiple times but also the famous 24-hour race of Le Mans twice.

programme.title: All-Wheel Vehicles for the Streets
programme.desc: The Audi Q2 is a sportback coupe is the entry-level model for the German brand’s SUV range. Also: test-driving the SsangYong XLV lifestyle SUV. And: Mercedes present their "sportscar among SUVs", the GLC Coupe.

programme.title: Wildly through the desert
programme.desc: BMW and the German racing team X-Raid take part in the Dakar Rally with a transformed Mini Countryman. Also: the Mercedes G63 AMG 6x6, a 6-wheel off-road monster. And: the Kia Sportage feels both at home in the rocky terrain of Sicily and the city.

programme.title: Tuning World
programme.desc: For more than 20 years the Tuning World Bodensee has been one of the top events in the European car tuning scene. Also: with their i-models BMW started to explore alternative drive technologies. And: taking the Nissan Leaf to Oslo.

programme.title: All New!
programme.desc: Following the Porsche 911's anniversary we take a look back at this iconic model's history. Also: the world's first series-produced plug-in hybrid with a diesel engine, the Volvo V60. And: safety measures in the car world, from seatbelts to crash tests.

programme.title: Enduro Park Hechlingen
programme.desc: The BMW Enduro Park Hechlingen in Bavaria offers off-road driving pleasure both for beginners and pros alike on 26 hectares. We take a look at what this exciting place has to offer for enduro enthusiasts. Also: what does the inexpensive Hyosung ST 700 i from South Korea have to offer? And: the big-wheeled scooter from Taiwan, the Kymco People GT 300i.

programme.title: Triumph Thunderbird
programme.desc: The parallel twin-cylinder Triumph Thunderbird. Is the powerful 1.6 litre bike able to gain a foothold outside of the British Isles? Also: Harley-Davidson's black chopper Sportster 883 Iron, a starter bike for purists. And: Bike & Music, a spectacle for motorbike and stunt enthusiasts at Europe's biggest motorway rest area in Geiselwind, Germany.

programme.title: Iconic Racing Classics
programme.desc: Cars like the Ford GT 40, the Jaguar D-Type or the Mercedes 300 SL wrote history on the race track and now break records at auctions. A sumptuously restored 300 SL will start at the most famous classic car rally in the world, the Mille Miglia.

programme.title: Saalbach Classic 2014
programme.desc: At the 2014 Saalbach Classic rally 80 teams raced their automobile rarities through the Austrian Alps. In addition: rally legend Walter Röhrl in a Porsche 911 RSR at the Cologne-Ahrweiler rally. And: the infamous Group B vehicle category.

programme.title: Turbo Diesel Power
programme.desc: We took a look at Audi's latest generation of TDI engines and their RS5 TDI Concept. In addition we compared the advantages and disadvantages of the two main fossil fuels for cars, gasoline and diesel. And: the 2014 Porsche Cayenne Diesel.

programme.title: Lightweight Cars
programme.desc: The BMW i8 was one of the first sports cars with some sort of a green image. In addition we took two fly-weight sports cars, the Lotus Elise and the Roding Roadster, to one of the most beautiful alpine pass roads.

programme.title: Supercars on the Rocks
programme.desc: Nissan's all-wheel monster GT-R had to prove its winter suitability and the new Porsche 911 with turbo engine was taken to its limits in Finnish Lapland. Also: the Mercedes-Benz S 500 plug-in hybrid.

programme.title: Lightness to the Extreme
programme.desc: The German manufacturer Roding created a car that even outshined the Porsche GT3 with an impressive power/weight ratio. British makes like the Caterham 620 R, Lotus Elise or Radical RXC also showed what's in play in regards to lightweight sports cars.

programme.title: The Fastest Cars in the World
programme.desc: Speed has always been one of the most important criteria when it comes to owning or driving a car. We show you our top 10 list of the fastest cars in the world.

programme.title: The Most Expensive Production Cars
programme.desc: Everyone knows that vehicles made by hand or in small numbers can be extremely expensive. But that can also be true for production vehicles. Here are our top 10 most expensive production cars.

programme.title: Fire!
programme.desc: It's getting hot in this episode of Stunt Heroes. Stuntman Paul will be engulfed by flames as everything around him blows up in this dangerous fire stunt. The Action Concept team carefully prepares for this heated scene.

programme.title: Revenge
programme.desc: The Stunt Heroes rehearse a car crash scene for a movie, in which it should seem as if the main character of the movie really drives the car. The team achieves this directive by using digital effects and constructing a special airbag.

programme.title: The White Army
programme.desc: The Stunt Heroes leave their headquarters and travel to a ski resort. They simulate the attack of an army of soldiers all dressed in white. As part of this scene they want to make a car explode and fly through the air.

programme.title: Porsche GT3 Streetracer
programme.desc: How do you top the already in many ways superior iconic Porsche 911? You come up with the GT3. It's the ultimate melange of road suitability and race track compatibility. And Porsche's RS model is even more intense.

programme.title: Limited Edition
programme.desc: The Tushek TS600, a limited edition super sports car had a power/weight ratio that is on the level of GT3 racing cars. The Bentley Continental GT3-R special edition was also limited whereas McLaren offered their 570S to all customers.

programme.title: The Most Successful Cars in the 24h Race
programme.desc: 24-hour races are one of the toughest tests for man and machine in motor racing. We present the most successful cars in this racing category in our Top 10 list.

programme.title: The Most Unusual Cars of Modern Times
programme.desc: You often get the impression that most cars are the same. But if you are looking for something special, you will find it. We present our top 10 selection of the most unusual modern cars.

programme.title: Mighty Convertibles
programme.desc: The Audi R8 Spyder is the most extreme convertible by the German brand. Also: the Ferrari California T scores with Italian passion and elegant lines. And: AMG's GT C Roadster with its roaring sound is a real bad boy with a touch of luxury.

programme.title: International Motor Show Frankfurt 2013
programme.desc: The stars of the 2013 IAA in Frankfurt were the Aston Martin Vanquish Volante, Porsche's 918 and 911 turbo models and the Jaguar F-Type coupe. Maserati introduced the Ghibli as a competition to Mercedes' E-Class and BMW's 5 series.

programme.title: Classic Cars with All-Wheel Drive
programme.desc: The Volkswagen Type 166 amphibious vehicle is the all-rounder amongst off-road vehicles. Also: the Peugeot 205 Turbo 16 all-wheeler turned the World Rally Championship in the 1980s on its head. And : the Willys Jeep in our drive report.

programme.title: Mobility in Eastern Europe
programme.desc: In the 1950s, companies like Tatra from Czechoslovakia introduced advanced, even pioneering automobiles. The clientele was exclusive, which is why now these streamlined cars are big rarities. We tracked down the owner of a 1937 Tatra T87.

programme.title: The big journey
programme.desc: The Mercedes-AMG E63 S is a wolf in sheep's clothing. This station wagon has more power than the Nissan GTR 'Godzilla'. Also: the Porsche Panamera GTS feels at home on the motorway and on the race track. And: Audi's powerful all-purpose executive car RS6.

programme.title: Pulse Rising Cars
programme.desc: With the Pulsar, Nissan returned to the European compact class market with a serious contender to the Volkswagen Golf. In addition: the American V8 dream sports car, the Chevrolet Corvette C7. And: Subaru's fifth-generation rally icon, the WRX STI.

programme.title: Mercedes ML 63 AMG
programme.desc: We put the Porsche Cayenne Turbo S and the Mercedes ML 63 AMG to the test. Also: the final round of the truck trial race at the Camp4fun at the Nürburgring in Germany. And: General Motors' new luxury SUV, the Cadillac SRX.

programme.title: Outback Off-Road Adventure
programme.desc: Australia's North-East is famous for its nature and wildlife. We accompanied the Germans Katrin and Uli on their 4x4 tour on the Great Tropical Drive in Queensland. Also: Clash of the Titans. We compared the Toyota Landcruiser and Mitsubishi Pajero.

programme.title: Harley Sportster 1972
programme.desc: Harley-Davidson add three additions to their model range of bikes: the motorized wheelie bike Sportster 72, the versatile Switchback Dyna, and the bad-boy ride „Softail Slim“. Also: two German bikers take a dusty adventure ride through Mexico on their BMW's. And: the Triumph Speedmaster, the British answer to Harley-Davidson's cruiser.

programme.title: Triumph Thunderbird
programme.desc: The parallel twin-cylinder Triumph Thunderbird. Is the powerful 1.6 litre bike able to gain a foothold outside of the British Isles? Also: Harley-Davidson's black chopper Sportster 883 Iron, a starter bike for purists. And: Bike & Music, a spectacle for motorbike and stunt enthusiasts at Europe's biggest motorway rest area in Geiselwind, Germany.
